The BEST Summer Camp in Vero Beach! ARE YOU READY FOR THE BEST SUMMER CAMP EVER? Why Should You Choose Our Awesome Summer Camp In Vero Beach? Why Should You Choose Our Awesome Summer Camp In Vero Beach? If you are a parent who wants your child to have tons of FUN this summer, then you are in the right place! Our campus is conveniently located in the Vero Beach area, and we have served hundreds of happy families like yours who also want a fun, safe, and affordable summer camp! Here at our summer camp, we love creating successful kids! We are committed to your child’s progress in school, sports, leadership, and life! Each week, your child will have the opportunity to participate in an exciting variety of indoor sports, outdoor sports, educational lessons, arts and crafts, and much more! We are excited for you to meet our team! In fact, we only hire the BEST coaches who have years of experience, are fully trusted, and have passed a comprehensive level-2 background check! (This is the same type of background check that is required to be a school teacher in Vero Beach.) Did you know that we have an incredible After School Program as well? It's true! Most of our summer camp families stay enrolled with us for many years! We serve students who attend these elementary schools: Imagine South Vero, Citrus Elementary, Beachland Elementary, Rosewood Magnet, Osceola Magnet, and Vero Classical! (We are happy to give you more details about that program as well when we connect!) It is EASY to join our Summer Camp family! Simply click the green button on this page, and we will contact you ASAP with our current tuition rates, weekly schedule, and how to enroll! This camp will sell out quickly, so don’t wait! Reply to this review Loving Life 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 1 1 out of 5 stars 06/17/2019 Staff was rude, restrooms dirty, grass not mowed, trash in river, broken down RV's with boarded up windows. An old rusty RV sitting there. Construction equipment coming and going all the time. Noseiums are all over, we could not sit outside at all and no one even cares or told us about them. The bites hurt and there is nothing that will help. Helpful 10 Own this park? Reply to this review true-reviewer 2 reviews · 2 review votes Member 2 2 out of 5 stars 09/28/2017 This park advertises free Wi-Fi at all sites. When I called to make the reservation I asked specifically if there was Wi-Fi at all sites and was told yes. Shortly after arrival I tried to get Wi-Fi and although the signal appeared to be strong it was marked as "Limited". There was no internet access. When I called the office I was told "sometimes it is down, try again later", which I did to no avail. The next day again with no internet access I went to the office and was told it was down and they... Read More This park advertises free Wi-Fi at all sites. When I called to make the reservation I asked specifically if there was Wi-Fi at all sites and was told yes. Shortly after arrival I tried to get Wi-Fi and although the signal appeared to be strong it was marked as "Limited". There was no internet access. When I called the office I was told "sometimes it is down, try again later", which I did to no avail. The next day again with no internet access I went to the office and was told it was down and they were waiting for the repair person. When I checked with some extended stay people at the park they said the WiFi had not worked for a very long time, so I was lied to repeatedly with regard to WiFi. Also, although they took my Good Sam number over the phone and quoted me the Good Sam rate, I had to ask repeatedly to get the 10% discount. The actual parking pads are extremely narrow and the hook-ups are all the way to the rear requiring additional sewer and water hoses. The grass also had not been mowed in awhile. There are numerous trees very close to the roadway around the rear of the park, making the ride to your site very interesting. The staff here were not very helpful, including the guide that led us to the site. We could have parked ourselves much easier. This is an over priced bare bones park not particularly close to any attractions. Read Less Helpful 12 Own this park? Reply to this review SailorKane 6 reviews · 6 review votes Member 5 5 out of 5 stars 09/12/2016 Very nice campground.  Better than most wifi.  cable tv included with tons of channels.  attractive treed sites.  Gravel, level sites.  Very close to beaches and convenient to shopping. Helpful 10 Own this park? Reply to this review The Davis Family 1 reviews · 1 review votes Member 4 4 out of 5 stars 10/19/2015 The site was very quite and very clean.  Host and service staff picked up trash from each site daily (if placed at edge/curb) .  Pets may not be left unattended (FYI - we left to go thrift store shopping and got a call that our pup could not stay outside unattended).  

Bring lots of bug spray because at dusk the "no-see-ums" and mosquito's were terrible.   The staff was wonderful and even gave us a bottle of Avon Skin So Soft to help with the bug bites. Not much you can do about it.

Plenty of... Read More The site was very quite and very clean.  Host and service staff picked up trash from each site daily (if placed at edge/curb) .  Pets may not be left unattended (FYI - we left to go thrift store shopping and got a call that our pup could not stay outside unattended).  

Bring lots of bug spray because at dusk the "no-see-ums" and mosquito's were terrible.   The staff was wonderful and even gave us a bottle of Avon Skin So Soft to help with the bug bites. Not much you can do about it.

Plenty of garage sales, thrift shops, shopping etc.  Most park goers seem to stay there year round so there was not much activity on the site. 

Sites are heavy gravel and a concrete pad for pulling up to/door entrances/picnic table.  Fire pit on each site.  Nice pool and cute little playground for our children. Would definitely visit this site again. Read Less Helpful 20 Own this park? Reply to this review See all reviews Book now View Website Location 8850 N US Hwy 1, Sebastian, FL 32958 Coordinates: 27.754500, -80.436520 Directions From Jct of I-95 (Exit 156) & CR-512: Go E 2.4 mi on CR-512, then S 5.8 mi on CR-510, then N 0.4 mi on US-1 (R) Get directions From $48 / night Book now View Website Previous Next How to read Good Sam Ratings The three-number rating that accompanies each campground listing in the directory gives readers an at-a-glance assessment of a campground's amenities, cleanliness and environment. All three ratings categories are measured on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being the best. Less than 1 percent of parks or campgrounds receive the coveted 10 | 10 | 10 rating, which indicates superior facilities that are well maintained, clean, well-appointed restrooms and a highly appealing appearance. Campgrounds are inspected annually by dedicated RVers like you. Completeness of facilities 10 10 10 The first campground rating evaluates completeness and quality of facilities. In this category we rate interior roads, sites, registration area, hookups, recreation, swimming, security, laundry, store and building maintenance. Cleanliness of restrooms and showers 10 10 10 The second rating category concerns the cleanliness and physical characteristics of toilets, walls, showers, sinks/counters/mirrors and floor. If a park achieves a full point in each of the above, it receives a star ( ), indicating exceptionally clean restrooms. Also rated are physical characteristics of restrooms, including interior construction, adequate supplies/odor free, adequate number of facilities, exterior appearance and location in relation to park spaces, and interior appearance. Visual appeal and environmental quality 10 10 10 This category addresses the park's setting and site layout, function and identification of signage, overall exterior building maintenance, noise, trash disposal, litter and debris around the grounds and sites, and appearance of grounds, sites and entrance area. If a park complies with 3 or more items from the following list, a special green designation will show in their listing. Non-toxic cleaning products Natural pest control (most of the time) Minimized the use of styrofoam and significantly reduce the use of plastic Landscape managers use appropriate irrigation systems and drought tolerant and indigenous plants Recycling cans for the RVers Changed light bulbs to compact fluorescent lights (CFLs) Insulated water heaters Lowered pool temperatures Installed photocells (solar) Use more fuel efficient vehicles Instead of golf carts, implemented a strategy of encouraging the use of bikes and trikes Tankless water heaters Composting What makes this park family friendly? Good Sam Camping gives special recognition to RV Parks that provide family-friendly amenities, activities and services. We were surprised at how much there was to enjoy in Vero and Sebastian.  This campground is located conveniently to points of interest in both cities.  We enjoyed a Clam Bake at Sebastian's River Park, rode the jungle trail and dined in Vero Beach.  Much more than that to see and do there. The campground provided reliable, fast Wi-Fi. She later established a local tutoring company and homework center in Vero Beach, where she recognized a growing need for a hybrid model of educationâone that bridges the gap between traditional schooling and homeschooling. How far to the beaches? We are 2.9 miles away from the beaches a quick 5-10 minute drive depending on traffic What months are considered Summer? We use our Summer rates from May 1st- September 30. Seasonal rates start October 1 and end April 30 See more about our rates here https://verobeachkamp.com/rates Do tent sites also have power and water? We provide both tent sites with power and water and tent sites without. Do you fill propane tanks? Yes we do! We fill grill tanks and tanks inside your rig! Are there waterfront RV sites? We do not back up to the water our park sits about 3 miles from the shore. We do have a small creek at the north end of our park that runs east to west and empties into the Indian River Lagoon. You might even see the family of otters that frequent our park! How can I book a site? At this time we are currently working on getting our park up for online bookings. With 120 sites, it’s a well-shaded retreat that offers a nice swimming pool and clean facilities, making it a solid choice for families and solo travelers alike. Campers rave about the friendly atmosphere and helpful staff, which really adds to the experience. Many appreciate the well-maintained sites, complete with picnic tables and fire rings for those classic campfire evenings. One visitor noted, “Really can’t say anything bad about our experience here—stayed for a week—no complaints at all.” If you’re looking to explore, you’re just a short drive from the beach and local attractions. Plus, the campground is conveniently located near the Indian River, perfect for those who enjoy water activities. Whether you’re here to relax by the pool or watch a rocket launch, Vero Beach Kamp has a little something for everyone.
